channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Car paked in Double yellow line, 5th February
item.description:
This car is now regularly parking in double yellow line . I made several complaints but there are no positive results. This obstructing road for other user .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hereward Gardens, Bowes, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TV dumped on Seal Street E8, 5th February
item.description:
Hello, please can you remove the dumped TV on Seal Street E8 at Shacklewell Lane. Thank you

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shacklewell Lane, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous pavement risk to falls and flooding at front door when rains, 5th February
item.description:
This is ongoing issue the pathways are not consistent around estate to doors water gathers from front door we use with buzzers when rains so have to use side door but becomes issue when other services have to access building and trip hazzard I have fallen and son. Saw nieghbour uneasy onn feet with mobility issues struggaling to walk without slipping or tripping other day. Also not easy for elderly to walk on as big cracks where pavement ajoins and mis alignment. It becomes slippery and grass areas are flooded when rain so becomes extremely muddy. It not well lit so it worse winter times.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10-18, Turpington Close, Bromley Common, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Untaxed vehicle blocking access to garages, 5th February
item.description:
Owner of car unknown but is parked in front of garage block. Unable to drive cars past it to get into back garages. Car has been there about a week and hasn't moved. It is untaxed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Elder Oak Close, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffitti on asylum rd, 5th February
item.description:
Ive brought this issue up before. The grafgitti is the height of the wall. Its been added to as we expect when nothing is done about it! The next step will be my local MP. Its opposite queens rd peckham station on quednz rd and half way down axylym rx before you get to the adylum pub. Trust me you cant miss it!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 103-147, Asylum Road, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light Lamp port does not turn off during the day time. Opposite 606 Rotherhithe Street, 5th February
item.description:
Street Lamp is not working

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rotherhithe Street, Rotherhithe, Greater London

item.title: Resident's dog keeps pooing near bike shed, 5th February
item.description:
An old pomeranian dog gets let out of the flat and poos and trots back in without the owners picking up the poo (witnessed 3 times). This has meant we've stepped or had our bike wheels go into the poo because it doesnt get cleared.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queen Elizabeths Walk, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damage caused by driving vehicle on footpaths, 5th February
item.description:
Is it really the best solution to drive a vehicle on a footpath that is not wide enough. Creating a huge rut alongside footpath and causing soil to be spread across footpath. Result is that footpath becomes slippery and dangerous to walk on and cost of damage repair to verges.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Croydon Road, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Accident with stroller because of broken pavement, 5th February
item.description:
Both my child and myself are injured because stroller flipped upside down because of the state in which the pavement is. Fix it!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Calmont Road, Downham, Greater London

item.title: Debris in front of No 82 Martins Road, 5th February
item.description:
